ygData.subject: RE: Who's who (was: RE: A new /who command (OT))
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Ok, so this works for say the guilds. Does it sift through the zone fields as well? (At work, I can t test this for myself right now.) ie. /w all oot
ygData.messageBody:
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Benjamin Jerrad Segal [mailto:birdman@...]
> Sent: Friday, January 07, 2000 4:32 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Who's who (was: RE: [eqbards] A new /who command (OT))
>
>
> On Fri, 7 Jan 2000, John Tatsukawa wrote:
>
> > As an addition, I've always had problems finding my
> guildmates for one of
> > the guilds that I belong to. Someone tried convincing me
> that there was a
> > "/who all guild" command, but that certainly doesn't work.
>
> Using quotes does work. Example:
>
> I am in The Revolution. Doing
>
> /w all the revolution
>
> will return The Erudin Arcanium, as they are alphabetically higher.
> However, if I do
>
> /w all "the revolution"
>
> I will get what I am looking for.
>
> (N.B. Abbreviating works, /w all "the rev" works identically.)
>
> Athren Notechaser
> Cazic-Thule

Ok, so this works for say the guilds. Does it sift through the zone fields
as well? (At work, I can't test this for myself right now.)

ie. /w all "oot"
